channel.description:
How do i make it so when you click on an item it deletes itself? Ive figured out how to make it do things like bring up a menu but i cant figure out the deleteItem thing. i get this errorz:
[code]client.java:9826: deleteItem(int,int,int) in client cannot be applied to (int) deleteItem(7629); ^[/code]

item.dc:creator: @Zhaedara Zhaedara
item.description:
@Zhaedara wrote:

[quote=“i_pk_pjers_i, post:8, topic:217848”][quote author=Zhaedara link=topic=286287.msg2317646#msg2317646 date=1215381971]

you know the [quote]public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType)[/quote]
code how it specifiys the ints that are going to be used make sure you have a public void for for deleting an item

Forget it…
I am a slightly noob coder and you are telling me something i dont even think you understand.

EDIT:
NVM I FINALLY GOT IT! You mean like for taking runes away per spell:

deleteItem(###, getItemSlot(###), #);
For like ### = rune ID and # = amount right?
[/quote]the only reason you dont understand it is because your not slightly a noob coder, you ARE a noob coder.[/quote]
I do understand it, it just took me awhile.

Read full topic

[/quote]

I am a slightly noob coder and you are telling me something i dont even think you understand.

For like ### = rune ID and # = amount right?[/quote]the only reason you dont understand it is because your not slightly a noob coder, you ARE a noob coder.
